quest.name: A Game of Cat and Fish
journal: Sisipu would have you learn a new technique.

Using the technique the acting guildmaster has termed “fishwheeling” (more widely known as mooching), you are to use a crayfish ball to catch a striped goby, and then recast the goby in order to catch a shadow catfish. The fish can be found in the waters surrounding Fallgourd Float in the North Shroud.

Sisipu expresses her gratitude for the shadow catfish and seems genuinely impressed by how far you have come in the field of fishing.

※The next fisher quest will be available from Sisipu upon reaching level 30.
objectives: Deliver a shadow catfish to Sisipu.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: You're familiar with the Culinarians' Guild, aren't you, Forename? If you couldn't tell by its supercilious name, their members are a finicky bunch, particularly the fussy Master Lyngsath.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: So when he comes asking for shadow catfish, no other fish will do, even if I kindly explain that fishing one out involves an arduous journey to Fallgourd Float followed by grueling labor. Naturally, I thought of you for the task.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: This will likely require a bit of “fishwheeling,” if you know what I mean, though I imagine you do not, as I just invented that word. It means recasting a fish you've just caught as bait for a yet larger fish.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: In my wisdom, I have deemed that your fishing prowess, land-faring acumen, and physical presence directly in front of me qualify you as the ideal candidate for the job.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: I have no doubts you'll be more than amply capable of fishwheeling or any other new terms I see fit to conjure up, for that matter.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Simply use crayfish balls to catch a striped goby, then recast that to catch the shadow catfish.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Take it from the inventor of fishwheeling: since the striped goby will become your lure, you'll want to catch the biggest, shiniest one you can find.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: A long journey lies ahead of you, and I fear the guild will not be the same in your absence. However, I choose to think of it not as losing a friend, but gaining a shadow catfish. Good luck!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Fishwheeling, or mooching as it is more widely known, involves catching a large fish and then recasting your line with the fish still on it in an attempt to land even larger prey. A high perception rating will increase your chances of catching fish of large size.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: You'll find the catfish you seek at Fallgourd Float in the North Shroud. Mayhap it's a tad presumptuous to say you will find one, but that's where they are, at any rate.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Lyngsath ought to crack a smile when he glimpses this beauty.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: They say never to look a gift fish in the mouth, but one can't help but stare at that gaping grimace─it looks like it could swallow a person whole!

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: I'm sure the fish of Gridania are none too displeased to see this one leave the water.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: I heard that yarzons covet the fish too, sometimes migrating north and attacking fishermen in hopes of stealing the catch. Suppose I should've warned you about that ahead of time.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Still, I don't see what all the fuss is about. For all the lengths one need travel and dangers one need brave, the fish tastes little better than mud...

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Pssst! Pardon me, but perhaps I might persuade you to prepare them in a proper bath? Water washes off the waste you can wipe away, but the invisible vapors only vanish with vinegar! You must mind the mud you can't see.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Speaking of the mud you can't see, where did you come out of all of a sudden!?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: A good guildmaster gusts in and goes out a gale. Now you see me, now you don't!

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Actually, I think we both still see you standing right there.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: But that is neither here nor there. Forename─there are few fishermen who could haul in the catch you did today.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Frankly, I've started to wonder how we ever got along without you!

obj.n: Like Fish Passing in the Night
